inn1.comm: starts with a full toss that swings away a bit further, Roy throws the hands but can't reach it
on the pads and whipped away, four off the first legitimate ball, trademark leg-side punch to get going from Roy
good length outside off, nipping back off the seam, shoulders arms and it flies through
overpitched and driven this time, rasping front-foot shot along the ground, past the dive of extra cover and that's another boundary
fired in full and straight, strangled lbw appeal as the ball runs away behind square
full, up towards the blockhole and Hales swings across the line, gets an inside edge on to his pads
slightly full, 147kph on the pads, clipped firmly but finds midwicket
starts a touch full, on the pads and flicked through backward square
short outside off, Hales drops back punches his first runs through backward point, wide of third man
full, 139kph on the pads, nudged behind square towards the sweeper on the fence
goes back and across, steers a push-drive between point and cover for one more
pitched up, 142kph and this nibbles away a fraction, past the outside edge as Roy swipes angrily at it on the walk
short, down the leg side, just a touch of inside edge on Roy's glance and it flies past the dive of de Kock and away for four more
full on the stumps and dug out
full outside off and Hales dismisses this to the boundary, his first, lashed through the covers coming forwards
pushed wide of mid-off and they take on the arm, Hales makes it safely to the non-striker's end
length ball on off stump, comes across to defend
touch full and straight, wristy punch from Roy and its laced past mid-on, the ball picks up speed, giving Morkel no chance in the chase. Timing
too full again, this time Roy strokes back down the ground, fine of the diving mid-on, mid-off successfully prevents four this time
good length on off stump, presents a straight bat in defence
whipped through square, Roy's back spasm is well behind him, he's moving like a greased eel... This is a fast outfield and the ball races away
better from de Lange, gets this one to straighten off a length, pops off a leading edge into the covers
back of a length, jumps across and defends on off stump
shortish at the body, this time Roy dabs it away through square leg for one
good length in the channel, Hales is still getting his eye in (going at a run a ball) and leaves it be
144kph in the channel, testing line and Roy allows it through
tight around off, good length ball, tapped down towards point
slightly back of a length, dropped down into the leg side... Behardien collects and throws down the stumps with Roy in his ground
dug in short, good pace from Morris but Roy gets on top of his pull wide of fine leg for a couple
pitched up outside off, opens the face on a drive through backward point
length ball on off, 145kph and defended... Morris just beginning to exert some control
de Lange does still get some extra bounce, 143kph on a length outside off, takes the edge and flies through third slip area - just one in and they get a single
straighter line and worked into the leg side
dug in short, Roy takes it on and top edges a hook... but there's not man back on the leg side and it sails safely down towards the fine-leg boundary, couple of bounces for four
goes over the top, on the drive this time, crumped for four more! Menacing stride out and clears the fielder
de Lange winds up, 146kph and tapped into the off side
dug in short... and that's outta the park! Picked this up sweetly on the pull and swung high beyond the rope at deep square leg. Roy is motoring
fired in full on leg stump, thuds the pads
pitched up outside off and creamed through the covers on the drive, Hales has got some catching up to do but that was a confident-looking shot
better length, gets the ball to tail in, past the outside edge as Hales pushes at it
on the pads, worked away behind backward square
slower ball from Morris, running his fingers over it, blocked into the covers
short and sharp, this gives Roy the hurry up and he's hit on the arm trying to pull, they pinch a leg bye as the ball runs through gully
slightly full and leg side, flicked for one
full and fast, on the pads and Hales again gets a tickle on it to fine leg
edged but wide of the diving slip! Roy gets another boundary, although not where he was intending

drives, through the shot a little early - taken at cover! Roy's fireworks are over, he tosses the bat in the air, knows he's given it away... The ball might have stopped in the pitch a little, the bat turned in the hands, but it was a tame way to go when he was looking like a million dollars
sliding down the leg side, flicks and missed
pitched up, gets across and mistimes a prod into the off side
full, 143kph on the pads, runs away behind square and Root will keep the strike
round the wicket, tossed up on the stumps, punched to long-on
flighted, pitching on middle and off, Hales knocks it back towards the bowler
on the stumps, closes the face and whips one through midwicket
goes back and tucks the ball to leg
floated up and Root pushes a drive in front of square, Tahir's throw is a bit wonky but they decide against trying for a second
tossed up and worked back to the on side
slightly back of a length, goes across and leaves outside off
on the stumps, Root shuffles into line and flicks to fine leg
length ball on off stump, Hales defends
fuller, 129kph, pushed gently into the off side
fired in at the stumps, Hales flicks wristily, in the air and bouncing to fine leg for another single
tossed up and driven back down the ground past the bowler
short ball, drops down and pulls through square leg for one more
over the wicket, flighted, driven into a gap in the covers
floated up outside off, Root comes forward and steers in front of square
full an flighted, worked off the pads through midwicket
pushed through outside off, Root goes back to cut and gets a bottom edge past the keeper... Morkel gives chase to fine leg and misses with his first flick back, still manages to stop four
very full, sliding down the leg side, Root waits on it and glances fine
cutter from Morkel, full on off stump, Hales dead-bats it from the crease
length outside off, Hales is confident in the bounce and opens up his body to slap h-i-i-i-i-i-i-g-h over mid-off, plops short of the rope and trundles for four - the first since Roy's dismissal
on the stumps, slightly shorter and worked to the leg side
pitched up and clubbed over mid-on this time! Hales brings out his nine-iron and chips for the green, handsomely struck but short of the rope again
Morkel fires the ball in full, aiming for the blockhole, squirted into the leg side for one
spiders in and drops the ball on middle and leg, flicked behind square
floated up slower, on off stump, defended pressing forwards
only slightly short from Tahir but Root picks it, sits back and swivels to pull flat through midwicket, between two men in the deep
tossed up, punched into the ground and Tahir catches it it... to cheers from the crowd before realising it was a bump ball
goes back and chops the ball towards point
flighted on the stumps, driven back through the hands as Tahir goes down to try and field
back of a length outside off, Root steers it through point - that's the England 100 up
slightly short again, this is too straight and Hales rocks back to thrash a pull through midwicket for four more
better line, extra bounce surprises Hales as he pushes outside off, a thick edge flies down to third man - no slip in for him now
good length, bobs forward and defends
back of a length, 143kph and turned off the hips, straight to midwicket
good pace, on the stumps, Root turns this squarer and they are able to pinch a single
loopy lebgbreak on the stumps, worked int a gap
googly from Tahir, full outside off and it turns right into the meat of Hales' blade as he crunches a drive through cover point
tossed up full on off stump, bunted into the ground back to the bowler
gets across and pushes fine of mid-on for one down the ground
full on the stumps, driven to mid-on
tossed up nice and high, again Root pings it towards mid-on fielder
bouncer from Morris, ducks underneath
dug in short, doesn't look particularly well timed as Hales haves to leg... but it sails beyond the rope, despite coming high off the bat
short outside off, stabbed through backward point
pitched up, Root pushes back down the ground towards long-on
angled in and flicked away through backward square leg - fifty for Hales, who's back in coloured clothing and back in the runs
back of a length, Root hops across and plays above the ball as it skittles through a little low
tossed up on the stumps, punched back along the ground
full on middle and leg, comes forward and drives one to long-on
on the stumps, worked into a gap on the leg side
tossed up outside off, pushed towards cover
here comes Hales, charges out and rockets the ball way back over long-on! Duminy tried to drag it down but ended up putting it in the slot, Hales swings through the line: ding-ding-ding jackpot!
tossed onto a good length, stout forward defence, channelling his Test-match instincts
extra pace and nip on a good length outside off. Root is comprehensively beaten, nibbling at the ball as it zips by.
up on the toes and poked into the covers. And, just like that, he's off the strike once more. He does that rotation thing rather well ...
sweetly driven from a full swinging length. But straight to short cover

a miscued hoick, and Hales' excellent knock comes to an ignominious end. Slightly too full for the cross-batted wipe that he aimed out towards midwicket, de Lange's extra pace means the ball is onto him too soon, and a toe-ended lob to cover gives South Africa a timely breakthrough
outside off, through to the keeper
clipped off the hip, out through backward square. Big outfield, but that also means big gaps. And that was timed too well to be cut off
driven to cover for a sighter
twirled onto a good length and defended
into position for the paddle sweep to get off the mark
dabbed down to long-on
full length, defensive edge into the gully
driven down to mid-off, a tidy over from the legspinner
pushed onto the back foot, defended into the covers
bouncer. Ducked
clipped to leg. Tight lines in this over
Buttler bides his time in a tight and probing over
outside off, through to the keeper
tight line, back of a length, nudged into the covers as Buttler plays himself in
Buttler squeezes another single
tossed up and tucked to midwicket
clipped firmly into the gap at midwicket, another quick single
chopped on the up to point, looking busy but the bowling is tight for now
very busy! Buttler's decided that 13 balls is quite sufficient to find his range! A skip down the track, inside out to take on the googly, and utterly lambasted over the long-off boundary!
attempts to work this one out to point but doesn't quite pick the gap
driven into the covers, solid timing once again
pushed onto the back foot and a sharp single into the covers
driven off the back foot again, finding space down at long-on
pulled sweetly, inside the line and through backward square, just helped round the corner
tonk! Stepped across the crease, full and flowing swing of the blade, Viv-esque deposit over cow corner. There's no bowling to that ...
outside off, can't get this one away. Buttler is in the mood already...
round the wicket, tossed into the leg-side, pushed to midwicket
clipped firmly out to midwicket
lining it up again but no venom this time
dropped short, deposited long! A vile half-tracker, spanked with disdain over midwicket!
width outside off, and Buttler gets sweepy, reversed through the vacant cordon. He's got something for all occasions
width again, Buttler has a mow but can't quite reach it to dispatch it
gentle inswing from a good full length, eased out to wide mid-on
too full, too wide, open face and steered through backward point. Runs, runs, everywhere
up, up and over, AB dives valiantly at long-on, but Buttler's lofted drive plugs, rolls and eludes him
fizzed through the covers! A measured step down the track and eased like butter on a crumpet through the gaping hole in the field
nudged into the gap, Root can have a turn to finish the over...
tapped to mid-on, Behardien's introduction has not been a success ...
tapped into the covers
driven, off a slight inside-edge, into the leg-side
short and wide, too wide. Root has a dart but can't connect
filleted through third man, easy as you like. Too wide, and Root rarely misses out on those
clipped off the pads, out through midwicket
on the back foot, tighter line, dabbed to point
two dots in a row. Riches
gentle, tantalising inswing at an offspinner's pace. Eased to mid-on
on the pads, another freebie, flicked down to backward square
driven into the covers
worked up to mid-on
chipped off a leading edge, Buttler had momentarily been done in by the lack of pace - a bit of a pop off the surface, but the lob lands inches short! Lucky!
short and wide, hammered out to the covers, another improbably tidy over
too straight, a pre-meditated stroll across the crease and a flick through midwicket. An effortless and brilliant half-century, and he is flying ...
can't get hold of this one
short, and Buttler climbs into a pull, and wears this one on the chest! Ouch... that'll teach him to shimmy at the crease. Or, rather, it probably won't ...
another firm drive into the covers
short, and leg-sided. It is called as the one bouncer for the over, though Root is rather miffed that it wasn't called wide
clipped hard to the leg-side. The merest threat of some sort of order being restored by South Africa in these middle overs
a woolly wipe into the off side, and unluckily for South Africa, Buttler's previous violence means there is no-one in anything remotely resembling a catching position in the ring ...
swung into the leg side, and this will be a free hit. Buttler has just called for a new bat too ... this could travel ...
well, something travelled but it wasn't the ball! The bails go spinning as Buttler's wipe across the line connects with nothing but fresh air. Good ball in any circumstances
clipped into the leg side
slaughtered over cow corner ... too short as Berhardien's attempted cutter ends up as a spankable half-tracker. Fetch that
fuller length, worked to leg
full length, Buttler can't work it away
short, too wide, Root is up on his toes to cut another boundary through backward point. There's another fifty for England's best all-round batsman
solidly forward, punched to cover
short, and Root's attempted cut doesn't connect
whisked into the leg-side
clobbered over the covers. Every ball is a coconut. Clippity-clop
pulled into the leg side
a dirty full-bunger, this one slips, and Root does well to watch as that was beaming towards his bonce. A free hit coming up
smeared into the off side, doesn't quite get full value for that
swished out to deep midwicket, good connection but the sweeper is in place
up on the toes, drilled into the covers
another single to the cause
down the track, aggressive intent, but Morris finds a restrictive full length and half fields in his followthrough
beautiful bowling! That's the sort of ball that's required on this deck. Very full length, lovely shape and late swing, and Root yorked himself as his bat came down across the line
down the leg-side, pulled firmly down to backward square
tossed into the blockhole, driven to mid-off
patted to cover, tight line to the new batsman
driven to cover
on the pads, flicked square. A decent over, exercising a measure of control after the wicket
solid leather-sniffing forward defence. Morgan is playing himself in, and why not. There's time enough to have a dart
open-faced drive, down to the sweeper on the extra cover boundary. Signs of reverse swing at a very hot and dry venue
outside off, swinging across the left-hander, who drives without connection
beautiful counter-punching. Morgan advances, working with the swing, and plonking the ball up and over the covers, head over the ball, confident footwork
driven again, but gathered behind the bowler
angled bat, defended out to gully
solid poke back down the pitch as Morris keeps it tight
pushed through on the stumps, Buttler clips one square
stays over the wicket, flighted on off, Morgan reverses the hands and swats to short third man
full toss, Morgan is down early, lays the bat out like a salver and ramps it fine past de Kock for a boundary
comes forward and pushes square
tossed up and reverse over point, in the air but a good solid chunk on it and the ball skates away for four more
pushed through flat on off stump, tapped into the covers
over the wicket, fullish outside off, mistimed pushing towards cover
nearly plays on! Skips out to try and go down the ground, thick inside edge on to the pads and it rolls just past leg stump
dug in very short and Morgan has to up periscope in order to pull through backward square for one
length outside off, Buttler calmly strokes one more through the covers
slower ball, waits for it on the stumps, deflected towards backward point... "No!" is the call
short ball, again taking some of the pace off, Morgan paddle-pulls to deep square leg - just three singles off the over
smited into the stands at deep midwicket! Morgan gets down low and levers the ball high and handsome on to the grass banks with an insouciant swat across the line - England bring up 250
flatter on off stump, pushed down the ground
worked back on the leg side, a misfield helps them to one

goes for another big hit downtown... but picks out long-off running in! Tahir strikes for the first time, Morgan looked as if he had the bit between his teeth but he's tripped over and landed on his face, came off the toe of the bat and Morkel took a good sprawling catch
tossed up and pushed square

short ball, pulled hard towards deep square leg for a flat six, hang on Behardien has got there and taken a brilliant one-handed catch not quite managed to hold on as he falls to earth! That was a truly spectacular effort, he had it in his left hand but it popped out as his arm jarred on the ground. All that for a single
banged in short and Buttler goes aerial again, this time where there's no man to stop him, ramped over the keeper
on the legs, flicks at it and the ball runs away via the padding
good length ball around off stump, calmly defended
comes forward and drives on the up
short ball, dug in and climbing over Buttler as he thinks better of hooking
back of a length outside off, Buttler dabs it straight down into the ground
pushed through flat on the stumps, poked away to the leg side
tossed up, Stokes pre-meditates a reverse-sweep, picks out the fielder
flat trajectory, steered square from off stump
drops back and tries to swat through the covers, mistimed
tossed up and Stokes it down early to sweep in conventional fashion, gets a couple to fine leg
on the stumps, stays in the crease and clips one more through backward square - decent over for SA
back of a length, on the hips, tucked towards midwicket
slightly overptiched and lasered in front of the man at deep cover! He hits the ball soooooo hard, the fielder was left for dust
short ball, Stokes jumps into position and wheels it away through deep midwicket, another firm connection on the pull
comes forward and drives a length ball towards mid-off
pitched up, again punched into the off side
touch short, frees the arms outside off, back-foot punch between mid-off and cover... it's well fielded and the throw, a direct hit,  then has Buttler diving to get back in his crease
round the wicket, short outside off, Buttler reverses the hands and sends it skimming fine of short third man for four more
tossed up and again he reverse-sweeps, this time straight to the fielder
flighted on the pads, comes forward and clips one out towards deep midwicket
drags it short outside off, Stokes cuts forcefully through mid-off for one to the sweeper
tossed up and dispatched! Couple of steps out and he sends the ball soaring over deep extra cover
even bigger, a brutal side swipe of a swing to leg, smashed several metres beyond the ropes at deep midwicket! Buttler's into the 90s!
back of a length, moves across and runs to the ball to third man
shortish, goes across and tucks on through square leg
back of a length, outside off, Stokes swings hard and misses as the ball tails away
waits for the ball and slaps a cut through the covers
length on off stump, Buttler comes across and taps it down gently
very full, almost bowled behind his legs! Just missed... and that'll be a wide instead
pitched up and driven through the covers to the sweeper
very full and hitting middle and leg if Buttler's reverse sweep had gone wrong... picks out short third man
length outside off, slapped through point
goes across on off stump, inside-edged on to his pads into the leg side
only a little short but Stokes wields his bat like a mace and clubs it through square leg for another boundary - 300 up for England
pitched up and punched down the ground coming forwards
length on the stumps, goes right across and flicks the ball fine for a couple more
shortish outside off and steered towards point
pitched up on the stumps, driven powerfully back down the ground for one - 50 partnership between these two, from 41 balls
banged in short and Buttler goes for a Federer forehand smash, gets a top edge past the diving de Kock - and he's on to 99

length outside off, drops back and squirts the ball wide of third man, they run back for the second... and off comes the helmet, a hundred from 73 balls for Buttler, his second in consecutive ODI innings
goes full and Buttler brings out his ramp, he plays that supremely well and scoops an ice-cream four to fine leg
fires the ball in full and Buttler gets an inside edge on to his pads
angled across from over the wicket, backs away and chops through the covers

got him, picks out AB in the covers! Buttler was trying to manufacture a big fat swipe over the infield, the ball wasn't quite full enough to drive and de Villiers clings on above his head... Buttler's fun is over, but England's may not be
pitched up across the left-hander, who pushes into the covers
full on the stumps, flicked towards midwicket this time
pitched up, some width on offer and Moeen takes full advantage, a languid thrash through the covers and it beats the man on the fence
on the stumps, cramped for room and he can't get it away
length ball outside off, Stokes steps away and aims a woolly woof down the ground, misses
pitched up and driven down the ground for one more
angled across, quite full and Moeen swings hard, slices a big outside edge down to third man

punched into the covers, Morris fires a throw at the non-striker's end... and it ricochets away off Stokes' bat, totally wrong foots the man backing up and runs for four overthrows. Raining and pouring for SA
short ball, takes the pace off it, Moeen waits and swats a pull to deep square
pitched up and Stokes can't do much with it into the covers.... Except Morne has been called for a no-ball. Replays suggest that was harsh
full outside off again, this time Moeen drills one down the ground

sixer! Is that Moeen Ali or Babe Ruth...? Length on the stumps and Moeen swings himself to leg like a drunken pirate, sends the ball steepling beyond the boundary, into the verdant banks beyond. Fetch
good response, fired in full and Moeen digs it out towards mid-on, de Villiers only just misses with a shy at the non-striker's end
full and slightly wide, Stokes leans back and carves the ball over the infield, bounces out towards deep extra cover between two fielders
swing and a miss from Stokes
pitched up outside off, chops down on it but fails to connect
tossed up on the stumps and swept flat through backward square for a couple
gone, out of the ground again! Tosses up the googly outside leg, Stokes is down on one knee to admonish it well beyond the ropes
six more, Stokes clubs another short googly over deep square leg and then falls over ins his follow through, such was the power imparted on the shot!
squeezed out into the covers for one
tossed up on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
goes down on one knee, hammered through wide long-on for another boundary. Dismissive
pitched up and slapped through point for four more, rasping square drive takes Stokes to fifty from 36 balls
goes round the wicket, fullish on the legs... and mullered down the ground for six more over long-on! Stokes on a Cape Town one
full toss and Stokes misses with the ramp, stumps a-splattered! He's better off just whacking it, didn't get the Fancy Dan shot right and Morris gets some respite, to go with a second wicket
pitched up and dug out towards mid-on
round the wicket, full on the stumps, Moeen swings hard and gets a thick inside edge through square leg
over the wicket, a high full toss this time, swatted through point for one - and another free hit coming up
saves himself with a precise yorker on middle and leg that Moeen can't do anything with
tosses up a legbreak to Jordan, who prods uncertainly at it and is beaten
tossed up and Jordan gets down to heave to leg, they think about two out to deep midwicket but Moeen will stay on strike
full on the stumps, swings into the leg side... straight to the man in the deep! Moeen looked a little off balance there, he was aiming for the stars but ends up in the gutter
flighted, outside off, pushed into the covers
pushed through outside off, swishes a cut and clips the toe end, runs to short third man
pushed through, Rashid whips his wrists through a flick to midwicket for one
timber! Morris gets the yorker and rattles Rashid's stumps! Swinging in a touch, under the bat and bull's eye
on the stumps, flicked through mid-on for a run off his first ball
fullish, punched through the covers off the front foot
length ball, on off stump, Willey closes the bat face and loops a leading edge through mid-off, short of the man coming in
pitched full and squeezed out back down the ground, Jordan knows there is two on and gets back
low full toss to finish his allocation, Jordan can't get under it, clubs one more down the ground
make that nine short... although it's almost a brilliant catch at long-off! The fielder got there, Behardien I think, dived to take the catch beyond the rope but couldn't quite throw it back in
Jordan heaves high into the leg side, Duminy is circling under it... taken! England are nine down, with four balls left, Jordan having just become the eighth batsman to clear the ropes
looses a leg-side full toss, Willey ducks... and de Kock only makes a token effort to go for it, so disgusted is he. That's another way for England to get there
pulled into the deep, wide of the man on the midwicket fence and they come charging back for two
length ball, clubbed down the ground, bouncing towards long-on... England on to 399
full length outside off, Tipley swings and misses, they don't try and pinch a bye
full, just outside off, again Topley fails to lay bat on it... and again they don't bother trying to steal an extra, so that will be that, England settling on 399 for 9. Phew!

inn2.comm: over the wicket, pitched up outside off, stays a little low, prod and a miss
there's the first SA boundary, bit of width from Willey and de Kock squires a square drive through the infield
drifts a little straight, glanced down to fine leg for one
angled across the right-hander, Amla feels for it, flicks the toe end but the edge dies in front of Buttler
full, hint of swing back in, played back towards the bowler
slightly wide, Amla reaches for a cut, steers through point
good length, goes back and across and defends
full, some swing for Topley, under Amla's eyeline and he drives to mid-on
pushed across, this doesn't come back and Amla can slash the ball wide of third man, raced away to the rope
pitched full and straight, clipped back down the track, Topley tumbles to grab in his follow through
on the pads, firm glance through square, straight to the man set back for protection
good length outside off, de Kock plays away from his body and fails to connect

bowled 'im, Amla drags on! The ball was wide, Amla went for it without moving his feet, thick inside edge and the bails were doing cartwheels... Eerie silence around the ground as the Mighty Hash wanders off
pitched up, 134kph on off stump, steps out to defend solidly
slanted across, slightly wide, du Plessis won't be tempted
back of a length, outside off, drops back and chops the ball down through gully to get off the mark
length ball outside off, slightly wide, de Kock cuts one more through point
pitched up on the stumps, blocked back towards the bowler
picthed up, only a fraction full but de Kock seizes on it, squirrels a couple back down the ground through mid-on
sliding on to the pads, clipped behind square
gets on to the front foot and dabs a single wide of mid-off
length delivery, 134kph on off, no sign of swing as de Kock walks across and tucks off his pads
pitched up in the slot to drive, sends it skimming along the ground to mid-off
touch too full from Topley and it's spanked back down the ground for four, lovely timing
drops back and chops through backward point
straightening a touch on the stumps, pushed back down the track
timed off the hips, too straight from Willey and du Plessis spraffs the haggis through backward square leg, behind the man in the deep, for four
leg-side line... too leg side, as the batsman misses
full length, 136kph outside the line of off, driven wide of mid-off, the weight coming forward nicely and he sets off straight away
on the stumps, tucked in the leg side for a single
on the hip, tucked to short midwicket
on the back foot, punched into the covers
down the track, chipped high and hard, right off the face of the bat but not quite to the pitch of the ball. It plugs just beyond the back-pedalling long-off
can't bowl there as a left-armer with fine leg up. Outside the line, Buttler dives valiantly but there's no cutting off that glance
clipped hard to square leg
driven hard into the covers. South Africa ticking along effectively but unremarkably
flicked firmly to short midwicket. Well intercepted
tight to off stump, stabbed down to third man
good restrictive line from over the wicket to the left-hander. Straight-batted to mid-on
flicked off the pads
down the track, aggressive intent, but Willey fields stoutly in his followthrough and pings off the zinga-bails like a boss. Du Plessis is safely back in his crease though
short-arm pull, out to deep midwicket. A decent over all told
outside off, zipping through, Buttler gathers
too short from Jordan and he's lucky to get away with that as de Kock pulls fiercely only for Topley to pounce on the boundary's edge with an agility that belies his gangling frame
pushed back into the crease, poked into the off side
misdirected, on the pads, flicked up and away and spinning out of the reach of the groping backward square leg
tight lines this time. Defended
glorious pick-up! Jordan strays onto de Kock's pads, and is effortlessly patted up, up and away, over fine leg with impeccable timing and elevation. Easy as you like
wicket-to-wicket stuff. There's dark clouds brewing in the distance
driven out to cover as the wind starts to pick up
panned straight  back down the ground! Du Plessis charges, Willey can't adjust and is nearly decapitated in his followthrough
down the ground again, an even better strike as he meets it on the up with the full-faced wallop, aiming up more than across, and bringing the bottom hand through with venom
punched hard back down the pitch
a tidier end to an expensive over. South Africa are brawling
on the hip, too short, pretty horrible line and length to be frank. And de Kock is in the mood to cash in on those all day. Swivel-pulled high over backward square again
round the wicket this time, back of a length again, but defended this time
glided down to third man, enough width once again
steps across the stumps to flick the ball, French-cricket-style, through the leg side. Well gathered with a dive on the edge of the rope
fuller length, outside off. A flowing drive but straight to cover
on the toes, chipped out to deep midwicket. That is the end of a very healthy powerplay
pushed into the covers, a bit of a gentle loosener
outside off, and despite a flamboyant dive from Jordan at slip that was a well-played late cut. Too much width, and helped through third man
driven hard, off the back foot, but short cover is well placed
tossed up, much fuller and straighter, and that zipped on and took the leading edge. Well bowled
thoughts about a pull but that was the googly, de Kock bails out mid-stroke and pats the ball to the leg side
fizzing onto the bat, a decent introduction
round the wicket and clobbered hard through mid-on, just back of the length and that rebounded off the angle, like a snooker ball fired into the cushion
flinched into the leg side again, Jordan's length is ... erratic today
clipped to the leg side
short, and spanlked through midwicket. That is terrible bowling, from round the wicket. Toe-ended, but any old splinter of contact would have sufficed
up on the toes to push into the covers
pounded down the ground. Whatever it is that Jordan is trying to do, it isn't working
good line and length as the ball grips and turns, googly-style, into a back-foot defence
half an appeal as Rashid tossed one up towards the pads
outstanding inside-out strike, on the up and over the covers, but Willey at long-off makes superb ground to field in a clatter of limbs
pulled urgently but a misfield at square leg gives them an extra run
working with the spin again, another single
chipped into the leg side
worked into the leg side
stunning strike. Du Plessis feigned to the leg-side, lured Moeen into a driveable length and spanked him hard and flat through the covers
a clip into the leg-side, and that is a very fine 37-ball fifty...
round the wicket, straight-batted to mid-on
tossed up and tapped back to the bowler

faster, flatter, and Moeen strikes, or does he? Beaten in flight, never quite to the pitch of the ball, and ended up playing all round a very straight one. They are going to review... and lo and behold that was turning so much it was missing leg!
on the pads, jabbed to the leg side and de Kock makes it back with a desperate slide. After which he hops to his feet, dusts himself down, and acknowledges the applause for a well-earned fifty
worked behind square once again
outside off, swept into the leg-side, fetched from way outside the stumps
swept hard, out to deep midwicket
on the back foot, and punched down to long on
back of a length, sliding towards the stumps, clipped hard to midwicket
down the track, clipped hard into the leg-side, eluding the dive at short midwicket
inside-edged, ricochets off the back pad, but safely away
utterly marmalised! Down on one knee, fiercely crunched across the line. The runs are flowing freely
whisked on the up, into the covers
clipped off the pads, out to midwicket

flatter ball, a perfectly timed pick-up, but the boundary is some 80 yards away, and look who is lurking in the shadows at cow corner ... it's Alex Hales, who pockets the ball in the long barrier position, and that's a tame end to a very fine innings
worked off the straight and narrow to square leg
tossed up, dipping late on a perfect middle-stump line. Chipped to short midwicket
firmly forward, driven off a slight inside-edge, and AB has a run for the first time in four innings!
on the pads, turning from leg to off, clipped to midwicket
outside off, turning away from the left-hander once again
floated up, pushed down to long-on
floated up from round the wicket, a bit of turn, clips the back leg, no real appeal
down on one knee, working with the cross-breeze which is howling now, and helped effortlessly into the slip-stream
swished out to leg once more. There's a tactic brewing there...
angled bat, defended out to square leg
big stride and worked into the leg side
attempted reverse sweep, but ends up blocking the ball with the toe-end of his bat.
jabbed down the ground
down the leg side, was there any bat on that? Nope, just a flick off the pads but they all count...
short, wide, slapped out to the sweeper on the off side
driven, high and hard over long-off! Beautiful strike
low full-toss and slammed through square leg. Vital runs ...
beaten this time, as the ball turns between bat and pad, but past the off stump
drifting on to the pads and clipped away through backward square, Jordan slides along the boundary but won't get there
tossed up and tapped away to leg

slapped down the ground, Stokes is running across from long-on... AND GRABS IT ONE-HANDED! Another moment of Stokes brilliance in the field has done for de Villiers, the ball seemed to be going for six, over Stokes' shoulder, until he thrust up an arm and plucked the cherry from the sky! He carries on galloping, barely breaking stride, celebrating in front of the stands, cool as you like
round the wicket, tossed up and tapped into the leg side
angled in and straightening, goes back and clips one through square leg
sliding on with the arm, hit on the pads as he goes back, the ball runs behind square as Buttler gives chase
gets across and turns away on the off side
gets down and plays the paddle sweep well, flicked behind square and away for four
tossed up and Duminy sends this even finer, Stokes is after it in the field again, dives along the boundary and just about saves one
ooh, luck for de Kock, goes back to pull and gets a bottom edge between his legs, runs away past Buttler... Rashid puts his hands to his head, thought he had pinned him in front there
gets forward and pushes a single down the ground
floats up a legbreak on off stump, defended coming forwards
tossed up and launched into the crowd, de Kock lands a big blow, another leg-side mow beyond the boundary

Moeen appeals, the ball hit de Kock in front of leg stump... and England decide to review. Looks a bit of a punt, this, struck above the knee roll and needs to turn a fair bit to be anything more than clipping leg... Yes, it's umpire's call, top of leg and not enough to overrule Shaun George's original decision
flat on off, skips out to hit over the top, inside out wide of long-off for a couple
on the stumps, drops back to tuck one through square leg
sliding on to the pads again, this deflects to short fine leg where the fielder swoops
floated up around round the wicket, Duminy comes forward to defend
short ball, helped around the corner on the pull
pitched up in the channel and Duminy chases it on the drive, past the outside edge
comes forward and punches on the up into the covers
jeepers, 'e's done 'im there, tight on off and seaming fractionally, late as Duminy tries to clamp down on it... an inch or two past the timber
drops back, 140kph and driven towards cover from the crease
rolls the fingers over the ball, short and slightly leg side, paddled fine for a single. Quiet over from all-action Stokes
over the wicekt, pitched up around off stump, pushed through mid-on
fullish again, punched down the ground to long-on for one more
touch straight, worked off the pads behind square for another single
full and wide, de Kock reaches for it but doesn't connect
cross-seamer from Topley, comes forward and whips a length ball from off stump through midwicket
full and straight, dug out but not past the man at midwicket
short ball from Stokes, another single to the de Kock total, pulled through square
back of a length around off stump, defended
drops back in the crease, punched towards cover
short again, misbegotten hook from Duminy, in the air but bouncing towards deep square leg

on the body and clipped behind square, beats the man on the fence... and that's the de Kock ton, his ninth in ODIs (to go with five fifties, helluva conversion rate). Helmet off, punches the air, takes the applause
dug in at the body, attempts to pull and it deflects behind square on the off side
full of a length on the stumps, 133kph and bunted back down the ground
gets across and works the ball into a gap at midwicket
pick up and plonked over deep midwicket, a brutal shakedown from de Kock, stepped across and slapped Topley upside the head for six
pitched full outside off, blocked into the off side
full in the channel, finds a gap at cover this time

stops in the surface, maybe a slower ball... and Duminy pokes it straight back to the bowler! Topley swallows it in his follow through, tosses the ball away in jubilation. Don't think he did anything different with the delivery but it popped off the face, startling Duminy and giving England a fourth wicket
bit of width, drops back to cut through point for one... bringing the new man on strike
length ball, extra spice on that salami, jumps to deal Rossouw a blow on the glove
on the pads, turned through midwicket for a single to get going
pitched up on the legs, clipped firmly into the ground but straight to midwicket
slower ball from Stokes, foxes de Kocks as he tries to pull, leaves him in a little discomfort after striking amidships
back of a length outside off, drops back and chops into the ground, he's alert to the danger of it rolling back
pitched up in the slot outside off, driven through the covers
punched down the ground, long-off has to run across and they get two
back of a length, tucked off the hips for one behind square
length ball, comes across outside off, driven into the ground but cover cuts it off
slightly full from Topley and it's larruped back down the ground, Rossouw getting forward to Battenburg four through long-on
on the attack again, skips forward and throws the hands, this time an inside edge screws towards mid-on
pitched up and dug out into the off side, Rossouw was haring through for the single and the throw missed... but de Kock might have struggled to make his gorund had they thrown to the other end
turned short into the leg side
short ball, rolling his fingers down the side, mistimed pull bounces through square
comes forward to a length ball, 135kph and driven towards mid-on, calls quickly for the single and Moeen elects not to pull the trigger
full length, 146kph up towards the blockhole driven towards mid-off
another slower-ball bouncer, Rossouw picks it and dances forward to panhandle four over mid-on, swatted in the air but clearing the man and away for four
full and straight, 139kph and dug out back to the bowler
on the pads, freebie from Jordan, glanced smartly passed short fine leg for four
de Kock whips another boundary off his legs, wristy flick in the air this time, over the man and skedaddling away
length on the stumps, cracked along the ground but straight to mid-on
continues to try and find a way through de Kock's pads, this time his glance finds midwicket
pitched up full outside off, driven through the covers to the sweeper
although that will help... picked up off a length and mullered beyond the rope at wide long-on, another imperious blow from de Kock
pitched up and clipped off the pads through square
full and straight, Rossouw is a little late on it, manages to deflect it behind square
short ball, angled across and de Kock doesn't go for it... not called wide
down the leg side this time, another to the total
short ball again, this time de Kock puts it away with a roundhouse pull between midwicket and deep sqaure leg
dug in, swings across the line, miscued back to Stokes, who's got a cob on
too much width, and Rossouw climbs into that, with a wristy thump through the covers. Jordan's battered figures take another blow
on the pads, clipped to midwicket
better ball, in the blockhole, just outside off, Dabbed to cover for a quick single
defended off a good length again, Jordan has tightened his line after that inauspicious return
drilled into the covers but without any timing. Good line and length again
good over in the end, completed with a full-length ball on middle and leg. too tight to free the arms. Worked to midwicket
round the wicket, slapped hard off the back foot to cover
tossed up on middle and leg, eased down to wide mid-on
pushed to cover
straightens on a middle-and-leg line, worked into the leg-side for another single
driven back to the bowler

that was the pressure that told in the end. Another well-flighted delivery, Rossouw aims something dramatic over the covers, but gets underneath his shot. Long-off hardly has to move, and if de Kock didn't already know it, it really is all on his plate now ...
width and driven hard to cover
wristily drilled into the covers. Smartly gathered
that is a fantastic way to get off the mark! Little more than a pushed drive, on the up, and whistling through the covers, albeit with a bit of a misfield ...
